purpleculture_pinyin:
jià
to harness; to draw (a cart etc); to drive; to pilot; to sail; to ride; your good self; prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞 )
запрячь; рисовать (тележка и т. д.); водить; пилотировать; плыть; ездить; ваше хорошее я; слово с приставкой, обозначающее уважение (вежливо 敬 辞)
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 驾)
Pictophonetic: 加 indicates the sound; 馬 (horse) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
駕駛 [ jià shǐ ]: to pilot (ship, airplane etc); to drive
駕馭 [ jià yù ]: to urge on (of horse); to drive; to steer; to handle; to manage; to master; to dominate
駕駛員 [ jià shǐ yuán ]: pilot; driver
駕車 [ jià chē ]: to drive a vehicle
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 加 [ jiā ] to add to, to increase, to augment
    • 馬 [ mǎ ] horse; surname
heisig_chinese_memo: People who love to drive like to add horse power to their cars. &nbsp
Ru_Meaning: vehicle, palanquin, litter, hitch up an animal
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 加 (くわえる、カ добавлять). Вероятно, первоначальные значения — ездить на лошади, запрягать лошадь. Но чаще используется для обозначения повозок и карет.

Ru_Radicals: 力 (сила), 口 (рот), 杰, 馬 (лошадь)
Ru_trainchinese:
jià: (графема) вежливое обращение к другому человеку
jià: (глаг) (транспорт) вести, управлять; запрягать; контролировать, управлять
Kanshudo_mnemonic: to the horse (馬) you add (加) a bridle
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Most people have moved on from horses and have added cars to their lives to drive around.
humanum_short_description_en: The " driving " variant is also referred to as " 𤙑 ", which refers to putting the horse in the carriage and preparing to drive. "Said Wen": "Driving, the horse is in the yoke. From the horse plus the sound. 𤙑, Yanwen driving." Duan Yucai: "The words of driving are added to the horse by the car."
humanum_short_description: 「駕」異體亦作「𤙑」，指把馬置於車套中，準備行駛。《說文》：「駕，馬在軛中。从馬加聲。𤙑，籒文駕。」段玉裁：「駕之言以車加於馬也。」

(Simplified: 驾)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 加 indicates the sound; 馬 (horse) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 加 [ jiā ] to add to, to increase, to augment
    • 馬 [ mǎ ] horse; surname
①把車套在牲口身上，使拉(車或農具)：駕車。駕轅。
②古代車乘的總稱，亦特指帝王的車，轉指帝王：車駕。法駕(帝王車乘的一種)。
③使開動，操縱：駕駛。駕機。駕馭(亦作“駕御”)。
④在……上面，超出：駕雲。凌駕(高出、壓倒誰或什麼)。
⑤對人的敬辭：大駕。尊駕。勞駕。駕臨。
駕駛 [ jià shǐ ]: to pilot (ship, airplane etc); to drive
駕馭 [ jià yù ]: to urge on (of horse); to drive; to steer; to handle; to manage; to master; to dominate
駕駛員 [ jià shǐ yuán ]: pilot; driver
駕車 [ jià chē ]: to drive a vehicle

駕字的基本解释

駕
jià
见“驾”。

駕字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jià］
［《廣韻》古訝切，去禡，見。］
“驾1”的繁体字。
(1)把车套在马等牲口身上。
(2)出动兵车。指兴师。
(3)乘。
(4)驾驶。
(5)车乘。
(6)指帝王乘坐的车马轿舆。借指帝王。
(7)陵驾；超越。
(8)传布。
(9)推动；掀起。
(10)莅临；登临。
(11)敬辞。尊称对方。
(12)象声词。多用于吆喝牲口。
(13)量词。一日之行程。
(14)量词。辆。
(15)通“架”。架设；构筑。
(16)通“架”。用胳膊支撑。
(17)通“架”。招架；抵挡。
(18)通“架”。放；安置。
(19)古地名。春秋楚邑。故址在今安徽无为境内。
[②]［jiā］
［《集韻》居牙切，平麻，見。］
通“加1”。“驾2”的繁体字。
添加；增多。

駕字的康熙字典解释

【亥集上】【馬字部】　駕； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1436第09
〔古文〕?【唐韻】古訝切【集韻】【韻會】居迓切【正韻】居亞切，?音嫁。【說文】馬在軛中。　又馭也。【禮·曲禮】君車將駕。【正字通】唐制，天子居曰衙，行曰駕。　又車乗也。漢制，六駕屬車八十一乗。【後漢·輿服志】天子出有大駕，有法駕，有小駕。　又別駕，官名。【通典】漢別駕，從事史一人，刺史行部別乗一乗傳車，故稱曰別駕。唐攺郡丞爲別駕，德宗時復省，今府通判是也。　又具車馬曰駕。【前漢·高帝紀】詔賢士大夫能從我游者，郡守身勸爲之駕，遣詣丞相。　又騰駕也。【揚子·法言】仲尼駕說者也。如將復駕其所說，莫若使諸儒金口而木舌。【註】仲尼乗行而贊述之。金口木舌，鐸也。言莫如使諸儒宣揚之也。　又陵駕也。【左傳·昭元年】子木之信稱於諸侯，猶詐晉而駕焉。【註】駕猶陵也。　又人名。【左傳】魯大夫榮駕鵞。　又【集韻】居牙切，音嘉。義同。　又叶古慕切，音故。【古逸詩·驪駒歌】驪駒在門，僕夫具存。驪駒在路，僕夫整駕。

Basic explanation of words
drive
jià
See "drive".
drive
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jià］
["Guangyun" ancient surprised and cut, go to 禡, see. ]
"Drive1" in traditional characters.
(1) Put the cart on horses and other animals.
(2) Dispatch military vehicles. Refers to the division.
(3) Multiply.
(4) Driving.
(5) Car ride.
(6) Refers to the carriage and sedan that the emperor rides. By referring to the emperor.
(7) Lingjia; beyond.
(8) Spread.
(9) Push; set off.
(10) Come here; come here.
(11) Respect. Respect each other.
(12) Onomatopoeia. It is mostly used for screaming livestock.
(13) Quantifiers. One day itinerary.
(14) Quantifiers. Vehicles.
(15) Through "frame". Erect; construct.
(16) Through "frame". Support with arms.
(17) Through "frame". Parry; resist.
(18) Through "frame". Put; resettlement.
(19) Ancient place names. Chunqiu Chuyi. So the site was in Wuwei, Anhui today.
[②]［jiā］
["Jiyun" is cut in teeth, plain hemp, see. ]
Pass "plus 1". "Drive 2" in traditional characters.
Add; increase.
drive
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Haiji 1】【horse character department】　jia; Kangxi strokes: 15; page number: page 1436 09
[Ancient text]? [Tang Yun] Ancient Surprised Cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] Ju Lingqie [Zheng Yun] Ju Yaqie,? Sound marriage. 【Said the text】The horse is in the yoke.　You Yuya. 【Li·Li】The king's car will drive. 【Zhengzitong】In the Tang Dynasty, the emperor lived as Ya, and walked as driving.　Car ride again. Han system, six cars belong to eighty-one cars. [Later Han·Yufuzhi] The emperor had a big driver, a law, and a small driver.　Don't drive again, official name. [Tong Dian] Don’t drive in Han Dynasty, only one person is engaged in history, and don’t take a ride in the provincial bureau, so it is called don’t drive. Tang Li Juncheng was not a driver, and Dezong was rehabilitated, and the current mansion passed the sentence.　With a chariot and a horse, he said to drive. [Pre-Han · Gao Di Ji] Those who can travel from me to the sages, the county guards persuade them to drive, and send the prime minister.　Take off again. [Yangtze·Fayan] Zhongni is also a speaker. As Jiang Fu Jiaqi said, Mo Ruo makes the Confucian scholars golden mouth and dumb tongue. [Note] Zhongni praised it by taking the trip. Golden mouth and wood tongue, duo also. Words are not as good as making Confucianists preach.　Ling Jia also. [Zuo Zhuan·Zhaoyuan Year] The letter of Zimu was called by the princes, and he still lied to the promotion. [Note] Jiayouling also.　Another name. [Zuo Zhuan] Doctor Lu Rong Jiaxian.　 [Ji Yun] Ju Ya Chi, Yin Jia. The same meaning.　 Ye Gu Muqie again, the sound is so. [Guyi Poetry·Liju Song] Liju is at the door, and the servant has a life. Liju is on the road, and the servant is driving.
